issue.title: [R] Installation instructions don't work on Ubuntu 18.04
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-4288](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-4288). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
The R package seems to require statically linking to Boost. One way to achieve this on Ubuntu is to use the vendored Boost.

See also ARROW-4286 which discusses namespacing Boost.

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-4288?focusedCommentId=16842748) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
The default build system behavior now is to use the Boost shared libraries; this should be adequate on Ubuntu 16.04 and higher (I think the Ubuntu 14.04 Boost libraries do not work out of the box at the moment)
